content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a great puzzle for speed clashes. If you want to add this puzzle to shortest, I think you should increase the complexity by giving the equation of a line, equation of shortest distance from a point to a line, and giving more than 2 points to the players. But overall, great puzzle

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I don't really think this could be solvable in less than 5 minutes, of course for those who are not at all familiar with linear algebra. Although, I find it pretty interesting and definitely must be approved , It's quite fun !
 ( A programmer should know some math concepts, at least from school, I was not trying to justify the ignorance towards linear algebra :D )

Another math problem, I'm afraid if I would remember the concept or get it right in a 15-min clash or not. The problem is clear about what it requires. Would leaving some hints for the process improve it?

For constraints,
Good that you've specified points 2 and 3, but somehow they are redundant (at least point 2, since point 1 mentioning that all inputs are integers already ensures that the integers can be either positive, negative or zero).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one, clear and new
Floating numbers may be quite tricky in some languages, so it make sense to round values up to integer, accordingly increasing all values by 10 times.

Nice one, not sure I'd manage to solve it in time, but still like it. ^_^

Suggestions

* Rephase 'The output values must be rounded to 1 decimal point.
keep the trailing zero (e.g. 2.0)' to 'The output values should be rounded to 1 decimal point.'. I think it's a neater description and easy enough to understand if a test case fails.
Alternatively, use a comma after 'decimal point, keep'.

Input section
* Please mention that the coordinates are space-separated.

Output section
* Please mention that the coordinates should be space-separated.

* Suggest to format the emphasised words in <<bold>> instead of making them ALL CAPS.

Constraints section
* Please move the last sentence to Goal section. It is an explanation of the requirement, not a constraint.

Game modes
* I think it is too difficult to guess the requirement in Reverse Mode. Suggest to disable it.

Cases
* The title to the first test is missing. Please add it.

Thanks.
I've implemented all your suggestions. Thanks.

it doesn't really require precision higher than a 32 bit float which is available in (I'm assume) all the languages. As for the formatting I'm requiring fairly rudimentary output which is usually available in most if not all languages. Also, there are plenty of puzzles/clashes that require a similar floating point output.

I think repeatedly stating 'space separated' is just annoying and redundant.
I would vote for removing it entirely, since it would be entirely clear from the example and lines, as well as the common practice in these challenges. Guess I just disagree with 5DNL1L on that on.

Without that "space-separated" the specification is incomplete. Also, not every stub generator in every clash/puzzle would split the string for you. You do have to know what the delimiter character is to split the string properly.

There can be better ways of doing it of course. For example, Goal section may mention (just once) that the coordinates are given and should be output in the format of x-coordinate and y-coordinate separated by a space. If so, both Input and Output sections may skip repeating that.

Also, you have misspelled my user name.
